perturbation.original_text: Galacticomm must provide a person(s) to correct any technical problems (Server being down or inaccessible) 24 hours per day, 7 days per week. This person(s) must be available by beeper or telephone. Horst Entertainment shall provide this same 24 hour service at the broadcast location.
perturbation.changed_text: Galacticomm will attempt to correct technical problems. Horst Entertainment shall provide service at the broadcast location.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates 24/7 technical support availability. The modified text removes the guaranteed 24/7 support and availability via beeper/telephone, weakening the obligation. This introduces legal risk because many jurisdictions imply a warranty of fitness for a particular purpose, which includes reliable service, in service agreements, especially when dealing with essential services. By removing the guaranteed availability, Galacticomm opens itself up to claims if the service is unreliable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Warranty of Fitness for a Particular Purpose (Uniform Commercial Code applicable in Florida)

perturbation.original_text: All parties have read and fully agree to all terms and conditions as set forth in this Web Hosting Agreement. Any disputes arising herein shall be settled in a court in FLorida.
perturbation.changed_text: All parties agree to all terms and conditions as set forth in this Web Hosting Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text contains a clause stating that disputes will be settled in a court in Florida. By removing this clause, it creates uncertainty about the venue for dispute resolution. While not explicitly against the law to omit a venue, the omission can lead to increased legal costs and complications if a dispute arises, as parties may disagree on the appropriate jurisdiction. In many jurisdictions, the absence of a clear forum selection clause can result in the dispute being litigated in a location that is less favorable for the consumer (Horst Entertainment).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Florida Statutes Chapter 672 (Uniform Commercial Code - Sales), which governs the enforceability of contract terms, including forum selection clauses.

perturbation.original_text: Horst Entertainment agrees to pay Galactcomm $0.01 (one cent) per access up to 400,000 accesses thereafter payment shall be $0.005 (one-half cent) per access. Horst Entertainment shall send this amount to Galacticomm by no later than Wednesday for accesses used from the previuos week (Monday thru Sunday).
perturbation.changed_text: Horst Entertainment agrees to pay Galactcomm a fee per access. Payment shall be sent to Galacticomm.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides specific pricing details (rate per access, threshold for reduced rate, and payment deadline). The modified text omits these crucial details, making the payment terms vague and unenforceable. This violates contract law principles requiring clarity and certainty in contractual terms, especially regarding payment. This lack of clarity is a legal contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles of Clarity and Certainty (applicable in Florida)
